summary: The SNAP Reform and Upward Mobility Act of 2025 (S. 1197) aims to reform the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP). Key provisions include improving poverty measurement by collecting more comprehensive data from federal benefit programs, modifying work requirements for SNAP recipients, requiring states to contribute matching funds for administrative costs, updating eligibility criteria, strengthening fraud investigation compliance, and establishing stricter rules for EBT card usage. The bill also addresses reauthorization for high-risk food retailers and mandates state activity reports.
